Micah or Micheas__05.1: Now shalt thou be laid waste, O<u>daughter of the robber</u>: they have laid siege against us, with a rod shall they strike the cheek of the judge of Israel.
Micah or Micheas__05.2: AND THOU, BETHLEHEM Ephrata, art a little one among the thousands of Juda: out of thee shall he come forth unto me that is to be the ruler in Israel: and<u>his going forth</u>is from the beginning, from the days of eternity.
Micah or Micheas__05.3: Therefore will he give them up even till the time wherein she that travaileth shall bring forth: and the remnant of his brethren shall be converted to the children of Israel.
Micah or Micheas__05.4: And he shall stand, and feed in the strength of the Lord, in the height of the name of the Lord his God: and they shall be converted, for now shall he be magnified even to the ends of the earth.
Micah or Micheas__05.5: And this man shall be our peace, when<u>the Assyrian</u>shall come into our land, and when he shall set his foot in our houses: and we shall raise against him<u>seven shepherds</u>, and eight principal men.
Micah or Micheas__05.6: And<u>they shall feed</u>the land of Assyria with the sword, and the land of Nemrod with the spears thereof: and he shall deliver us from the Assyrian, when he shall come into our land, and when he shall tread in our borders.
Micah or Micheas__05.7: And<u>the remnant of Jacob</u>shall be in the midst of many peoples as a dew from the Lord, and as drops upon the grass, which waiteth not for man, nor tarrieth for the children of men.
Micah or Micheas__05.8: And the remnant of Jacob shall be among the Gentiles in the midst of many peoples<u>as a lion</u>among the beasts of the forests, and as a young lion among the flocks of sheep: who when he shall go through and tread down, and take, there is none to deliver.
Micah or Micheas__05.9: Thy hand shall be lifted up over thy enemies, and all thy enemies shall be cut off.
Micah or Micheas__05.10: And it shall come to pass in that day, saith the Lord, that<u>I will take away thy horses</u>out of the midst of thee, and will destroy thy chariots.
Micah or Micheas__05.11: And I will destroy the cities of thy land, and will throw down all thy strong holds, and I will take away sorceries out of thy hand, and there shall be no divinations in thee.
Micah or Micheas__05.12: And I will destroy thy graven things, and thy statues out of the midst of thee: and thou shalt no more adore the works of thy hands.
Micah or Micheas__05.13: And I will pluck up thy groves out of the midst of thee: and will crush thy cities.
Micah or Micheas__05.14: And I will execute vengeance in wrath and in indignation among all the nations that have not given ear.
